What is the Ruby code to answer the following questions about the movie Titanic:
1. Which two main characters share the same first letter in their first names?
2. How many letters are in the full name of the character who famously declares "I'm king of the world" while standing on the bow of the ship?
3. Which main character is portrayed by Leonardo DiCaprio?
4. Name the character who is engaged to the wealthy Cal Hockley.
5. Who is the main character who narrates the story as an elderly woman in the present day? 
Please provide the [Ruby code] to answer these questions.

To answer these questions about the movie "Titanic" using Ruby, you can create a simple script that stores the necessary information and provides the answers. Here's an example of how you might write such a script:

```ruby
# Define the main characters and their attributes
characters = {
  "Jack Dawson" => {
    actor: "Leonardo DiCaprio",
    famous_declaration: "I'm king of the world",
    engaged_to: nil,
    narrator: false
  },
  "Rose DeWitt Bukater" => {
    actor: "Kate Winslet",
    famous_declaration: nil,
    engaged_to: "Cal Hockley",
    narrator: true
  },
  "Cal Hockley" => {
    actor: "Billy Zane",
    famous_declaration: nil,
    engaged_to: "Rose DeWitt Bukater",
    narrator: false
  },
  "Old Rose" => {
    actor: "Gloria Stuart",
    famous_declaration: nil,
    engaged_to: nil,
    narrator: true
  }
}

# 1. Which two main characters share the same first letter in their first names?
def characters_with_same_initial(characters)
  initials = Hash.new { |hash, key| hash[key] = [] }
  characters.each_key do |name|
    initials[name[0]] << name
  end
  initials.select { |_, names| names.size > 1 }
end

# 2. How many letters are in the full name of the character who famously declares "I'm king of the world"?
def length_of_name_with_declaration(characters)
  characters.each do |name, attributes|
    return name.length if attributes[:famous_declaration]
  end
end

# 3. Which main character is portrayed by Leonardo DiCaprio?
def character_by_actor(characters, actor_name)
  characters.each do |name, attributes|
    return name if attributes[:actor] == actor_name
  end
end

# 4. Name the character who is engaged to the wealthy Cal Hockley.
def character_engaged_to(characters, engaged_to_name)
  characters.each do |name, attributes|
    return name if attributes[:engaged_to] == engaged_to_name
  end
end

# 5. Who is the main character who narrates the story as an elderly woman in the present day?
def narrator_character(characters)
  characters.each do |name, attributes|
    return name if attributes[:narrator]
  end
end

# Execute the functions to get the answers
puts "1. Characters with the same initial: #{characters_with_same_initial(characters)}"
puts "2. Letters in name of character declaring 'I'm king of the world': #{length_of_name_with_declaration(characters)}"
puts "3. Character portrayed by Leonardo DiCaprio: #{character_by_actor(characters, 'Leonardo DiCaprio')}"
puts "4. Character engaged to Cal Hockley: #{character_engaged_to(characters, 'Cal Hockley')}"
puts "5. Main character narrating the story: #{narrator_character(characters)}"
```

This script defines a hash of characters, each with attributes that are relevant to the questions. Then, it defines functions to extract the needed information and prints the answers. You can run this Ruby script to get the answers to your questions.
